rows.title: Breathe to three

transcript.eng:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

You are a star!

rows.transcript:
Close your eyes. 

Use the magic power of three to stay connected and relax.

Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe in to the count of three. 1, 2, 3. 
Breathe out to the count of three. 1, 2, 3.

Do you feel any different? Deep breathing helps our whole body and mind to calm down. 

You are a star!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great to hear that you are doing well. You are a wonderful parent!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Sorry to hear that you are not having a great  day. Well done for trying to figure everything out. Nobody has all the answers, but we all try to do our best!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sorry to hear that you are not having a good day. Well done for getting up every morning and trying again, even when you are tired. That is real courage and dedication!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Sorry to hear that you are stressed today. Call or text a supportive friend to tell them how you are feeling. You might feel better afterwards!

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Not getting enough sleep or food can make us feel tired sometimes. Try having a healthy snack when you feel your energy levels dropping.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today's topic is about helping your child learn and grow. 

Playing with your child is important for their growth and learning, both in and out of school. This is true for all children, including those with disabilities.

Did you know that playing helps your child learn what is expected and how to get along with others?

Children learn a lot by asking questions. Support their interests and curiosity, and be patient when they make mistakes. We all learn from our mistakes!

media_title.eng: How will it help you and your family?

media_transcript.eng:
Hello!
Do you know that children learn best through playing? 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

rows.text_1_facilitator:

rows.media_title: How will it help you and your family?
rows.media_transcript:
Hello!
Do you know that children learn best through playing? 

And let’s be honest, which child does not like to play? 

Learning takes time, but there is a lot that you can do as a parent to help your child. Let them play and explore. Let them ask questions and learn from mistakes. And be patient. Your support will help them grow and develop.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Children learn best by playing and doing. 

@data.characters.f1_father.name wants to spend more time helping his daughter , @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, learn through play together. Let’s see how he does it.

character_1_text.eng: Hi, dear. Would you like to do something fun together?

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Children learn best by playing and doing. 

@data.characters.f1_father.name wants to spend more time helping his daughter , @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name, learn through play together. Let’s see how he does it.
rows.character_1_text: Hi, dear. Would you like to do something fun together?

character_1_text.eng: What would you like to do?

character_2_text.eng: Build a house out of pillows!

character_3_text.eng: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

rows.character_1_text: What would you like to do?
rows.character_2_text: Build a house out of pillows!
rows.character_3_text: Great idea! What do we need to do first?

character_1_text.eng: First, we place one pillow against the headboard. It’s our first wall! Then, we can use another pillow for the other wall. And a third pillow to make the roof!

character_2_text.eng: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

rows.character_1_text: First, we place one pillow against the headboard. It’s our first wall! Then, we can use another pillow for the other wall. And a third pillow to make the roof!
rows.character_2_text: It's lovely to see you thinking everything through so carefully.

character_1_text.eng:
Well done,
@data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name! This is a wonderful pillow house.

character_2_text.eng: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

rows.character_1_text:
Well done,
@data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name! This is a wonderful pillow house.
rows.character_2_text: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f1_father.name helped his daughter learn by playing together. Let’s explore how he did this.

quiz_1_question.eng: What did @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name learn when her father played with her?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng:
Actually, their play together helped @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name to lead and give instructions. By self-directing, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name learned how to give clear instructions and lead an activity. This is an important skill for any successful adult!

There are other correct answers in this list. Did you find them all?

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng:
That’s right! By creatively imagining what a home could be, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name finds an innovative way to repurpose a pillow. In her imagination, she could be building a castle, a tent, or space shuttle. Innovation and creativity are critical skills for the future. 

This isn’t the only thing @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name learned! Did you find the other things she learned?

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng:
Rather than copying the home he lives in, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name is encouraged to imagine new possibilities & problem solve. By imagining a world with a house that doesn’t yet exist, and creatively solving a challenge, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name is learning critical skills for academic and professional success. 

There are more right answers in this list. Did you find them?

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng:
That’s right! By testing and trying materials to build a house, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name is learning critical STEM skills and the parts of 3-dimensional shapes. 

There is more than one answer in this list! Did you find them all?

quiz_2_question.eng: How did @data.characters.f1_father.name help his daughter learn these skills?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: By telling her what to do

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Rather than telling her, he played with her. Their play time together created so many opportunities to learn new skills.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Actually, by simply playing with his daughter and letting her lead the activity, @data.characters.f1_father.name helps his daughter learn. He doesn’t have to show her how to build a fort, she learns on her own with natural consequences.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f1_father.name lets his daughter lead, he allows her to explore the laws of gravity (will the pillows fall?), 3-dimensional shapes, and build communication skills.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: That’s right. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises his daughter, she learns that it is good to be curious, inventive, and attentive to detail. She is more likely to repeat these behaviours in the future because she has been praised for them.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1:
Actually, their play together helped @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name to lead and give instructions. By self-directing, @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name learned how to give clear instructions and lead an activity. This is an important skill for any successful adult!

There are other correct answers in this list. Did you find them all?

This isn’t the only thing @data.characters.f1_daughter_2.name learned! Did you find the other things she learned?

There are more right answers in this list. Did you find them?

There is more than one answer in this list! Did you find them all?

rows.quiz_2_option_1_text: By telling her what to do

rows.quiz_2_feedback_4: That’s right. When @data.characters.f1_father.name praises his daughter, she learns that it is good to be curious, inventive, and attentive to detail. She is more likely to repeat these behaviours in the future because she has been praised for them.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Children (just like us) can learn a lot from their mistakes.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_son_4.name to learn from his mistake when she struggles to put on his shoes.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Children (just like us) can learn a lot from their mistakes.

Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name supports @data.characters.f3_son_4.name to learn from his mistake when she struggles to put on his shoes.

character_1_text.eng: Let me put your shoes on.

character_2_text.eng: No, I want to do it myself!

character_3_text.eng: Okay, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, you can do it yourself.

rows.character_1_text: Let me put your shoes on.
rows.character_2_text: No, I want to do it myself!
rows.character_3_text: Okay, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, you can do it yourself.

text_2.eng: @data.characters.f1_son_4.name doesn't push his foot in all the way and struggles to fasten the shoes.

character_2_text.eng: Yes, you can! How about I help you with one foot, and you do it with the other?

rows.character_2_text: Yes, you can! How about I help you with one foot, and you do it with the other?
rows.text_2: @data.characters.f1_son_4.name doesn't push his foot in all the way and struggles to fasten the shoes.

character_1_text.eng: Hold your shoe in both your hands. Now, place your left foot in the shoe. Almost there! Wiggle your toes and make sure your heel is all the way in. Good job! Now, you try with your right shoe.

character_3_text.eng: Great job,@data.characters.f3_son_4.name! You are becoming a strong boy!

rows.character_1_text: Hold your shoe in both your hands. Now, place your left foot in the shoe. Almost there! Wiggle your toes and make sure your heel is all the way in. Good job! Now, you try with your right shoe.
rows.character_3_text: Great job,@data.characters.f3_son_4.name! You are becoming a strong boy!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_uncle.name helped @data.characters.f3_son_4.name help him learn from the mistake.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: He fixes what he was doing wrong for him.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Rather than fixing the problem himself, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name gives clear and specific instructions to help him learn. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name carefully instructs @data.characters.f3_son_4.name on how to put on his shoes, helping him to do it himself.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: He get frustrated when he struggles

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: When @data.characters.f3_son_4.name struggles, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name actually remains calm and patient. This is important when teaching children new tasks.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: He praises him when he does it himself.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, praise helps our children to take more responsibility for their actions next time.

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: He tells him he is going to do it for him when he is struggling.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: @data.characters.f3_uncle.name actually encourages @data.characters.f3_son_4.name to keep trying after he struggles. This shows support and helps him to learn to do it himself!

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: I can keep trying even if I make a mistake.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_son_4.namelearns it’s okay to make mistakes and keep trying because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name encourages him to keep trying even when he struggles.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: I am supported as I learn new things.

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learns that he is supported while learning new tasks, as @data.characters.f3_uncle.name calmly guides him.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: It is important that an adult do this task for me.

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name actually learns the value of trying things on his own, with @data.characters.f3_uncle.name offering praise and support rather than taking over the task.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Rather than fixing the problem himself, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name gives clear and specific instructions to help him learn. @data.characters.f3_uncle.name carefully instructs @data.characters.f3_son_4.name on how to put on his shoes, helping him to do it himself.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: When @data.characters.f3_son_4.name struggles, @data.characters.f3_uncle.name actually remains calm and patient. This is important when teaching children new tasks.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes, praise helps our children to take more responsibility for their actions next time.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: @data.characters.f3_uncle.name actually encourages @data.characters.f3_son_4.name to keep trying after he struggles. This shows support and helps him to learn to do it himself!

rows.quiz_2_option_1_text: I can keep trying even if I make a mistake.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_1: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_son_4.namelearns it’s okay to make mistakes and keep trying because @data.characters.f3_uncle.name encourages him to keep trying even when he struggles.
rows.quiz_2_option_2_text: I am supported as I learn new things.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: Exactly! @data.characters.f3_son_4.name learns that he is supported while learning new tasks, as @data.characters.f3_uncle.name calmly guides him.
rows.quiz_2_option_3_text: It is important that an adult do this task for me.
rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: @data.characters.f3_son_4.name actually learns the value of trying things on his own, with @data.characters.f3_uncle.name offering praise and support rather than taking over the task.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Children grow and change at every age, and your support makes all the difference! 
Here are tips to help your child thrive:

section_1_text.eng:
Play is the main way children learn and develop. Through play, they build important physical and social skills. 

Set aside time to play games with your child, be creative, and have fun together.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Through play, you also learn what kind of support your child may need.

Support your child to play and make friends with other children, so they learn how to interact with others well. 

If your child starts to feel overwhelmed with anything in their day, help them reduce their stress by taking a pause and playing together.

section_2_text.eng:
Learning new things takes time. Be patient and encourage your child to keep trying things they may find hard. 

Stay calm when they get angry or frustrated - your child will learn to do the same over time.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
You can support them by praising them for trying and helping them break large tasks into smaller tasks that are appropriate for their age.

Use play to help your child learn difficult skills like losing, sharing, or taking turns.

section_3_text.eng:
Children learn by asking questions and exploring the things they are interested in. Give your child time and space to do this. 

Join your child’s activities and ask them questions to encourage them to learn more.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Your child may talk a lot and have many questions - including difficult ones. You can give your child short but honest answers. 

If you need a break or more information, you can take a pause and tell your child you will respond to them later.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Want to help your child develop and grow?

Your home activity is to invite your child to play with you today. Encourage them to ask questions and explore new things through play.

quiz_1_question.eng: What could you do today to encourage your child to play and learn?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That’s right! Join in on any play activity your child is doing. You will strengthen your bond and encourage your child to play and learn more.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like balancing on a step or collecting seashells or rocks along the way.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a music instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That’s right! Join in on any play activity your child is doing. You will strengthen your bond and encourage your child to play and learn more.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Great idea. Try to look for opportunities to play and learn, like balancing on a step or collecting seashells or rocks along the way.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Yes! Get creative. Anything in your home could be a music instrument, costume, or item in a role-play.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Exactly. If you are not sure how you could play together, your child will have many ideas for what you could do.
rows.quiz_1_question: What could you do today to encourage your child to play and learn?
